SEARCH
Package ui

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
ui.Sprite
public class Sprite extends Object
The Sprite class represents a sprite with animations. It manages the spritesheet, dimensions, current frame, scale, animations, and provides methods for updating and drawing the sprite.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(String spriteName, double abs, int rows, String currentAnimName, SpriteAnimation[] anims, float scale)
      Constructs a Sprite object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      spriteName - The name of the spritesheet.
      abs - The absolute value used to calculate the width of each frame.
      rows - The number of rows in the spritesheet.
      currentAnimName - The name of the initial animation.
      anims - The array of sprite animations.
      scale - The scale of the sprite.

  • Method Details

    • setAnimation

      public void setAnimation(String name)
      Sets the current animation based on its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the animation to set.

    • update

      public void update(int elapsed)
      Updates the sprite animation.
      Parameters:
      elapsed - The elapsed time since the last update.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2d, double x, double y, int... dims)
      Draws the sprite on the specified graphics context.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The graphics context.
      x - The x-coordinate of the sprite's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the sprite's position.
      dims - Optional dimensions for the sprite. If provided, the sprite will be drawn with the specified width and height, ignoring the scale of the sprite.
